p: Regarding the antimicrobial activity of aqueous and ethanolic extracts against reference strains of bacteria, all plant extracts were observed to have some antimicrobial activity against at least one reference strain ( Table 4). For A. cordifolia, relatively high antimicrobial activity was observed for aqueous extracts with zone of inhibition ranging from 19 to 29 mm and ethanolic extracts with zone of inhibition ranging from 17 to 28 mm. For J. flava and M. arboreus mean zone of inhibition was zero for both E. coli ATCC 25922 and S. typhi ATCC 33458 with both aqueous and ethanolic extracts. However, J. flava showed a relatively moderate activity against MRSA (zone of inhibition; aqueous = 15 mm, ethanol = 13 mm) and S. aureus ATCC 25923 (zone of inhibition; aqueous = 18 mm, ethanol = 16 mm). Similarly, M. arboreus showed a relatively moderate activity against MRSA (zone of inhibition; aqueous = 15 mm, ethanol = 12 mm) and S. aureus ATCC 25923 (zone of inhibition; aqueous = 0 mm, ethanol = 12 mm).
